page.title: 05ARKELLS KINGSDOWN BREWERY
page.content: The brewery company of{J.Arkell & Sons {Ltd.}was established in 1843 in Lower Stratton. In 1861 a new brewery was built at{Kingsdown.}Succeeding generations of Arkells have continued to run the brewery and in 1985 it remains in independent family ownership. Brewing is carried out in the traditional method. The original steam powered equipment is still used. The brewery and its tall chimney are a familiar sight and the smell of hops is often borne on the wind across our area. 74 people are employed at the brewery. Arkells own 66 tied houses, 6 of them in our area and as far afield as Hilmarton, Cirencester, Lambourn and Wroughton. Three draught beers are brewed, BB, BBB and Kingsdown Ale, plus a keg beer and a lager. A fleet of 6 lorries delivers the beer. The free trade extends as far as London.
